Ad Text:
About the Opportunity

Our state government client is seeking an experienced Commercial Reporting Analyst to strengthen its commercial reporting and financial analysis capability. This role sits within a central finance function and plays a key part in improving how commercial performance is measured, understood, and acted on.
  
What’s in it for You?

Hourly rate: $79.17 - $94.59 per hour + Super (negotiable)
Temporary full-time role
Brisbane-based role (Brisbane CBD or Mt Gravatt) with hybrid flexibility after onboarding
Opportunity to influence commercial strategy at an enterprise level.
Work with experienced finance leaders in a collaborative environment.
Meaningful work that improves financial transparency and performance.
Your New Role:
As the Commercial Reporting Analyst, you’ll lead the development of consistent commercial reporting methodologies and provide high-quality analysis across contracts, projects, and business initiatives. Your work will directly support executive decision-making and future commercial strategy.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement consistent commercial reporting frameworks.
Analyse revenue, costs, margins, and profitability across contracts and projects.
Provide reporting that supports executive and board-level decision-making.
Identify profitable and loss-making activities to inform future strategy.
Deliver specialist advice on commercial financial reporting and analysis.
Support financial modelling for business cases, tenders, and funding initiatives.
Partner with stakeholders to improve financial insight and commercial outcomes.
Transfer knowledge and uplift internal capability to ensure sustainability.
Drive continuous improvement across reporting and analysis practices.
What You’ll Need to Succeed
Demonstrated experience in financial modelling, analysis, and reporting.
Proven ability to design and implement commercial reporting frameworks.
Strong understanding of accounting standards in a commercial environment.
High-level analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to engage and influence stakeholders at multiple levels.
Confidence working in a fast-paced, change-focused environment.
Highly Regarded:

Tertiary qualifications in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field.
CPA or CA qualification (or working towards).
Experience with developing robust Power BI dashboards and advanced Excel skills.
Next Steps: Click Apply and upload your resume. It is beneficial to submit a cover letter.
  
Interviews will commence the week of the 12th January 2026.

Kingston Human Capital specialises in recruitment and human capital management services to the Queensland Government and Public Sector.

If this role isn’t quite right for you, but you are looking for a similar role, please reach out to us for a confidential discussion about your career.
  
Angela Burchett
